APPLY_FIXES.title: Apply linters formatting and auto-fixes
APPLY_FIXES.description: 'all' to apply formattings and auto-fixes of all linters, or a list of linter keys

ADDITIONAL_EXCLUDED_DIRECTORIES.title: Additional excluded directories
ADDITIONAL_EXCLUDED_DIRECTORIES.description: List of additional excluded directory basenames to add to Mega-Linter default excluded directories. They are excluded at any nested level.

DEFAULT_BRANCH.title: Default git branch
DEFAULT_BRANCH.description: The name of the repository default branch. Warning: In new github repositories, master branch is named main, so you need to override this value with main

DEFAULT_WORKSPACE.title: Default Workspace
DEFAULT_WORKSPACE.description: The location containing files to lint if you are running as docker image

DISABLE.title: Disabled descriptor keys
DISABLE.description: If DISABLE is set, the linters in the listed descriptors will be skipped

DISABLE_LINTERS.title: Disabled linter keys
DISABLE_LINTERS.description: If DISABLE_LINTERS is set, the listed linters will be skipped

DISABLE_ERRORS.title: Disable errors
DISABLE_ERRORS.description: Flag to have the Mega-Linter complete with exit code 0 even if errors were detected.

EMAIL_REPORTER.title: Activate Email reporter
EMAIL_REPORTER.description: Mega-Linter can send email with reports to given adresses. Please set EMAIL_REPORTER_** variables if activated

EMAIL_REPORTER_EMAIL.title: Email reporter: E-mail addresses
EMAIL_REPORTER_EMAIL.description: Comma-separated list of recipient emails, that will receive reports

EMAIL_REPORTER_SEND_SUCCESS.title: Send email reports even when success
EMAIL_REPORTER_SEND_SUCCESS.description: Define to true if you want to receive reports by mail even when there is no errors or updated sources

EMAIL_REPORTER_SMTP_PASSWORD.title: Email reporter: SMTP server password. Never hardcode it in a config variable, use secrets and context variables

ENABLE.title: Enabled descriptor keys
ENABLE.description: If ENABLE is not set, all descriptors are activated by default. If set, all linters of listed descriptors will be activated by default

ENABLE_LINTERS.title: Enabled linter keys
ENABLE_LINTERS.description: If ENABLE_LINTERS is set, only listed linters will be processed

EXCLUDED_DIRECTORIES.title: Excluded directories
EXCLUDED_DIRECTORIES.description: List of excluded directory basenames replacing Mega-Linter default excluded directories. They are excluded at any nested level.

FILEIO_REPORTER.title: Activate File.io reporter
FILEIO_REPORTER.description: If you don't use artifacts upload to read Mega-Linter reports, you can access them with an hyperlink to file.io. Important: Mega-Linter has no affiliation with file.io, but it's supposed to be secured, and only one download is available for a report (snapchat for files, basically)

FILTER_REGEX_EXCLUDE.title: Excluding regex filter
FILTER_REGEX_EXCLUDE.description: Regular expression defining which files will be excluded from linting

FILTER_REGEX_INCLUDE.title: Including regex filter
FILTER_REGEX_INCLUDE.description: Regular expression defining which files will be processed by linters

FLAVOR_SUGGESTIONS.title: Flavor suggestions
FLAVOR_SUGGESTIONS.description: Provides suggestions about different Mega-Linter flavors to use to improve runtime performances

GITHUB_API_URL.title: GitHub API base URL
GITHUB_API_URL.description: URL where the github API can be reached. Must be overriden if using GitHub Enterprise

GITHUB_COMMENT_REPORTER.title: Activate GitHub PR Comments reporter
GITHUB_COMMENT_REPORTER.description: Posts Mega-Linter results summary in the comments of the related pull request (if existing)

GITHUB_SERVER_URL.title: GitHub server base URL
GITHUB_SERVER_URL.description: URL of the GitHub instance. Must be overriden if using GitHub Enterprise

GITHUB_STATUS_REPORTER.title: Activate GitHub Status reporter
GITHUB_STATUS_REPORTER.description: Posts a status on the pull request for each processed linter

GITHUB_WORKSPACE.title: GitHub Workspace
GITHUB_WORKSPACE.description: Base directory for REPORT_OUTPUT_FOLDER, for user-defined linter rules location, for location of linted files if DEFAULT_WORKSPACE is not set

LINTER_RULES_PATH.title: Linter rules path
LINTER_RULES_PATH.description: Directory for all linter configuration rules. Can be a local folder or a remote URL. Not necessary if your linters configuration files are at the root of your repository

LOG_FILE.title: Log file name
LOG_FILE.description: The file name for outputting logs. All output is sent to the log file regardless of LOG_LEVEL

LOG_LEVEL.title: Log level
LOG_LEVEL.description: How much output the script will generate to the console. One of INFO, DEBUG, WARNING or ERROR.

OUTPUT_FOLDER.title: Output folder
OUTPUT_FOLDER.description: The location where the output reporting will be generated to

PARALLEL.title: Parallel processing
PARALLEL.description: Process linters in parallel to improve overall Mega-Linter performance. If true, linters of same language or formats are grouped in the same parallel process to avoid lock issues if fixing the same files

PRINT_ALPACA.title: Print le lama NUL (alpaca)
PRINT_ALPACA.description: Enable printing alpaca image to console output

SHOW_ELAPSED_TIME.title: Show elapsed time
SHOW_ELAPSED_TIME.description: Displays elapsed time for each linter in reports

TAP_REPORTER.title: Activate TAP reporter
TAP_REPORTER.description: General execution log mega-linter.log (same as ConsoleReporter log) + a separate log file for each processed linter

TAP_REPORTER_SUB_FOLDER.title: TAP reporter sub folder
TAP_REPORTER_SUB_FOLDER.description: Sub-folder of reports folder containing TAP logs

TEXT_REPORTER.title: Activate text reporter
TEXT_REPORTER.description: General execution log mega-linter.log (same as ConsoleReporter log) + a separate log file for each processed linter

TEXT_REPORTER_SUB_FOLDER.title: Text reporter sub folder
TEXT_REPORTER_SUB_FOLDER.description: Sub-folder of reports folder containing text logs

VALIDATE_ALL_CODEBASE.title: Validate all code base
VALIDATE_ALL_CODEBASE.description: Will parse the entire repository and find all files to validate across all types. When set to false, only new or edited files will be parsed for validation.
